holidays.name: Swap Ideas Day
holidays.description: A creative day dedicated to exchanging ideas with friends, family, or colleagues to spark innovation and fresh perspectives.
holidays.origin: While not officially documented, this day encourages collaboration and brainstorming, often celebrated informally among creative communities.
holidays.funFact: People claim that some of the greatest inventions have come from simple casual idea swaps on days like this!

holidays.name: TV Dinner Day
holidays.description: A nostalgic celebration of the classic TV dinner, a pre-packaged frozen meal designed to be eaten in front of the television.
holidays.origin: This day honors the first introduction of the TV dinner by Swanson in 1953, revolutionizing convenience food culture.
holidays.funFact: The original TV dinners were inspired by airplane meals and came in a tray divided into three compartments.

holidays.name: Goddess of Fertility Festival (Roman)
holidays.description: A lesser-known ancient Roman observance venerating a fertility goddess to ensure bountiful harvests and prosperity.
holidays.origin: Rooted in Roman pagan tradition, this festival celebrated fertility and the earth‚Äôs abundance around early September.
holidays.funFact: Offerings during this festival often included wheat, flowers, and honey to honor the fertility goddess.

holidays.name: Be Late For Something Day
holidays.description: A whimsical holiday that encourages you to embrace tardiness for fun, reminding us not to be overly stressed about punctuality every once in a while.
holidays.origin: Created by a humorist who wanted people to relax and enjoy life without the pressure of rushing.
holidays.funFact: Some cities have unofficial events where people purposely arrive 'fashionably late' together to celebrate this day!
